name: Pressure Cooker Split Pea Soup
author: Knifehat
summary: This is my favorite split pea soup recipe. I love my pressure cooker and use it for meals that I need to cook for the family in a hurry. This is great for a cold winter's night, and it tastes great for lunch the next day. I serve it with French bread.
ingredients: 1 teaspoon hot pepper sauce (such as Tabasco®)  (Optional)
directions: Pour water into a pressure cooker
Add split peas, ham hock, onion, celery, thyme, garlic powder, and black pepper
Close cooker securely and place pressure regulator over vent according to manufacturer's instructions
Bring to high pressure; adjust temperature until regulator is gently rocking
Pour cold water over the pressure cooker to release pressure according to manufacturer's instructions
Remove ham hock and strip off meat; add to soup
Season with salt and hot pepper sauce
